alert.note: Alert for McKean; Potter; Tioga (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:53AM EST until January 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow heavy at times, followed by some mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with locally up to 5 inches on the higher terrain. Ice accumulations of a light glaze. Southeast winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...McKean, Potter and Tioga Counties. * WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 1 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the area late this afternoon into early this evening. The snow may come down heavily for a period of 2 or 3 hours before changing over to a wintry mix or light rain and drizzle late tonight.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
